As a child I always used to be very confused
every time I saw the letter “U” in any

English word. I somehow did not get the concept
of U. I always use to curse the person, who

ever invented U. You see But is but, however
Put is put, Unite is unite, however Untie
is untie, didn’t make sense to me. So I read, read, read, avoided, read and suddenly revelation happened.
Hi my name is Emmelda and today we will discover

how to pronounce “U” correctly in English.
Let’s check out the sounds U can make. I’m

sorry, I’m not saying you can make, but
the letter “U” can make. First sound is

“Uh” as in but, curl; this is pronounced
as curl, duck… duck, lungs. When you say

the sound or when you bring out the sound
“Uh”, feel your vocal cords, you will

feel a vibration, uh…, uh, your jaws are
much relaxed. You don’t have to stress any

of your facial muscles, but you will feel
a vibration here, uh, but, curl, duck, lungs,

church, umbrella, umbrella, untie, feel the
vibration. So that’s the ‘uh’ sound,

but, curl, duck, lungs, church, umbrella,
tummy, tuck as in tuck in. The next sound

that we have is the ‘u’ sound. It’s
unlike the Oooo sound, it’s not the u sound,

but it is Ooh sound. It’s very small, doesn’t
show they require your vocal cords much, your

jaw is slightly changed from a very relaxed
position to u, look at my lips, it’s not

Oooo, but u, bush, could. Lot of people pronounce
this word as Kud. “Kud have a glass of water

please “No its not Kud. Do not pronounce
the “O”, but the “u” could, put or

push. Tuna, its Tuna and not toona. It’s
not what you say as tune, aa, but it is tuna,

bush, could, put, tuna, cucumber. Then you
have the next sound as the “You” sound.

It’s not u, its you. You need to focus on
the Y here. You as in you or blue, blue, cute,

duke, united, uniform, unicorn, mute, flute.
So these are the words which have you sound

and they are different than the u sound. When
you say Pupil. This has the you sound, it

doesn’t have pupul. This word is push. It
has Pu, this has Pu, however it has the you

sound, pupil, push. And there’s a reason
why we have u verses U sound. We will explain

it later. So quick recap Uh, feel the vocal
cord uh, but, curl, duck, lungs, church, dust,

tummy, tuck, u, push, bush, could, put, tuna,
should, would. Concentrate on the u rather

than uh sound. The last is you, blue, cute,
feel the you in it, feel the you sound in

it, blue as in U. Yeah that’s the sound,
blue, cute, duke, united, mute. Let me explain

why there’s a difference between, Uh, u
and you. You will have the sound you, when

there are few conditions met, first is U plus
E becomes You, doesn’t really look quite

convincing, but I will tell you why? U is
the most dependent vowel. In order for you

to bring that you sound, you will need to
have another vowel attached to it. Possibly

it is the i sound; it is not ee, but i sound,
short i sound or the short e sound. So it’s

u plus e is You, for example, blue, cute,
duke, here it is that the sound y comes into

place. The second condition is, if you have
a U, you have a consonant plus you have either

the E or the I alphabet, again the sound is
very important. You’re focusing on the short

i sound. For example, the word uniform, united.
Yes here’s an exception because you have

UN, the sound is I. The exceptional word will
be unidentified. Then it becomes UN, however

most of the U and I becomes Uni or Unique.
So U plus a consonant, plus the E sound or

the Ehh sound becomes or usually comes with
as sound as uni. The second condition here

is that you need to have only two vowel sounds,
uni as one and form as a second one, uniform.

Anything that is beyond it, for example, unidentified,
so you have Uh sound, you have I sound, you

have Ehh sound, you have I sound again. Then
it becomes the Uh sound. Otherwise most of

the times, if you have a word which has five
or six letters, you have only two vowel sounds,

uni as one and second is the Uh sound. It
becomes Uni, united, uniform. So that’s

about it. It’s a very simple straight forward
U sound. We have just three sounds that you

can actually take as in Uh, but, curl, duck,
lungs, mud, church, dust as in dusty shirt.

Then we have the Oooh sound. Please be very
careful, my European friends tend to say this,

let me push it for you and do not push it
for me or pull. Let me pool it for you, don’t

pull that word so much, just pull, pull. So
it bush, could, put, tuna. Again notice this,

if you have words such as should, please concentrate
on the U sound and not on the O sound. So

it’s could, but not cauld, could, should,
would. The last sound that U actually has

is, blue, cute, duke, united. Reason why we
have the U is either, U has to follow or U

has to come with E or U has to come with a
consonant and a E sound moreover, the entire

word, should have less than two vowel sounds.
So that’s about it. This is what we have

for you in this lesson. I come to end of this
lesson. I hope you enjoyed learning with me.

Until I come back with a new lesson. Have
